subject: logging: switch to lg2
commitMessage:
logging: switch to lg2

After switching to C++20, it is recommended to use `phosphor::lg2`
to format log, and the correct `CODE_LINE` and `CODE_FUNC` values
can be used in log tracking.

Tested: built ledManager successfully and Unit Test passes.

Before: The file does not exist or is empty
After: The file does not exist or is empty, FILE_PATH = /usr/share/phosphor-led-manager/lamp-test-led-overrides.json

MESSAGE=File does not exist, FILE_PATH = /var/lib/phosphor-led-manager/savedGroups
LOG2_FMTMSG=File does not exist, FILE_PATH = {PATH}
CODE_FILE=../../../../../../fp5280g2-workspace/sources/phosphor-led-manager/serialize.cpp
CODE_LINE=63
CODE_FUNC=void phosphor::led::Serialize::restoreGroups()
PATH=/var/lib/phosphor-led-manager/savedGroups
SYSLOG_IDENTIFIER=phosphor-ledmanager
_PID=298
_COMM=phosphor-ledman
_EXE=/usr/bin/phosphor-ledmanager
_CMDLINE=phosphor-ledmanager
_SYSTEMD_CGROUP=/system.slice/xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager.service
_SYSTEMD_UNIT=xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager.service
_SYSTEMD_INVOCATION_ID=5ddd4960a3b04fe29c34e4ce03b6be06

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I5ec8530e0b539bcf8d7d211c802430698aebd343

I think this one was fine how it was?
Okay, Updated
shouldn't need the c_str() since path is a string.
Done
don't need
Done
any reason why moving from ERROR to errormsg?
Done

May I know why this change is being made ?. Is there a limitation with the current approach ?. If so, please could you detail those in this commit message ?.

Also, if you could capture the before and after logs in this commit message, that would be helpful too.

Since we have updated to C++20, GCC11, we can use the fmtlib to quickly format string, and just use
https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt format like many repos are already doing.

```
{fmt} is an open-source formatting library providing a fast and safe alternative to C stdio and C++ iostreams.
```

> Also, if you could capture the before and after logs in this commit message, that would be helpful too.

~# journalctl -b | grep ledmanager
Jan 01 00:00:33 fp5280g2 phosphor-ledmanager[234]: File does not exist, FILE_PATH = /var/lib/phosphor-led-manager/savedGroups
Jan 01 00:00:33 fp5280g2 phosphor-ledmanager[234]: The file does not exist or is empty, FILE_PATH = /usr/share/phosphor-led-manager/lamp-test-led-overrides.json
Please capture the before and after traces for the same line of code in the commit message ?
Ack
We were having these as entries before.. How does that look with this change ?
When we use the fmtlib format string, we do not need to customize some entities, which will make it more convenient for us to quickly query the log

Thanks, I think we can remove it and use `lg2::`
Done
Sure.  You could have just switched to `PHOSPHOR_LOG2_USING;`, which simply reduces the usings to the log types themselves instead of also adding the flags.

I'll let the maintainers here decide what they want to do with these, but generally I've not put the tags in the messages.  Something like this is much less work:

"Failed to parse ({SIG}) getService mapper response: {ERROR}"

I think we can let the maintainers here decide.
Now I think it can be kept as it is 😊
It is suggested to also update .clang-format so that strings do not need to be broken anymore.
Yes, I have updated it in another patch: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-led-manager/+/46118
That commit you referenced does not have a .clang-format in it.  Please make a commit before this one to update the .clang-format and then unbreak all of the strings you added.
Updated
Remove `.what()` throughout.
Done
Did this not work without the ".str"?  Please open an issue to me for phosphor-logging support of sdbusplus::message::object_path and add a TODO here referencing it.

> Did this not work without the ".str"? 

Yes, did not.
created an issue: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/issues/25
Just 'path' should work here (and throughout).
Done

There is no need for this 'to_string' here.  Best I can tell this is an enumeration.  I think a cast to int should suffice.

If this is a common pattern, in another project I know I've written an 'underlying_cast<...>' using https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/types/underlying_type
I would suggest a longer tag than 'OP'/'NP'.  Maybe "OLD_PRIO" or "OLD_PRIORITY"?
Ack
Done

The preference is to reference the task here:

  TODO(phosphor-logging#25): support sdbusplus::message::object_path directly.
Ack
